Instruction: Heat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) and lightly grease a 15x10 inch jelly roll pan.

Combine 1 cup butter, water, and 4 tablespoons of cocoa in a large saucepan. Bring it to a boil and then remove from heat. Add 2 cups flour, 2 cups white sugar, and salt while it's still hot. Mix well. Beat in eggs, sour cream, and baking soda without overmixing.
Bake in a greased 15x10 inch jelly roll pan for 20 to 25 minutes at 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.

To prepare the icing: In a saucepan, bring 1/2 cup of butter or margarine, 4 tablespoons of cocoa, and 5 tablespoons of milk to a boil. Remove from heat. While still warm, add confectioners' sugar, vanilla, and nuts. Stir well. Ice the cake while the icing is still warm.
